root.src.model.tm.tm_predict module

Functions relevant to making a prediction

root.src.model.tm.tm_predict.TM_MODEL_PREDICT(tm_df: DataFrame) → DataFrame[source]

Load persisted model -> apply preprocessing methods -> predict

Parameters:

tm_df (pandas dataframe) – Each value in ‘processed_text’ column should be a list of tokens

Returns:

tm_df appended with ‘Predicted Topic’

Return type:

tm_df (pandas dataframe)

root.src.model.tm.tm_predict.batch_predict(corpus: List[List[tuple]], model) → List[List[tuple]][source]

Make batch prediction :param corpus: Each embedded list within is in the form [(word id, importance), (word id, importance) …] :type corpus: list :param model: Either lda, nmf, lsa :type model: gensim model object

Returns:

Each embedded list contains tuples of form (topic label, proba)

Return type:

(list)

Get top topic for each review :param row: Each row of data from a dataframe :type row: List[Tuple[str, float]]

Returns:

A string that contains the main topic that the review is about

Return type:

(str)

root.src.model.tm.tm_predict.predict(bow_document: List[tuple], model) → List[tuple][source]

Get topic model predictions :param bow_document: A document in the form of [(word id, importance), (word id, importance) …] :type bow_document: list :param model: Either lda, nmf, lsa :type model: gensim model object

Returns:

Each embedded tuple is of the form (topic label, proba)

Return type:

mapped_pred (list)

root.src.model.tm.tm_predict.preprocess(list_of_text: List[List[str]]) → List[List[tuple]][source]

Conducts bow preprocessing on a list of text :param list_of_text: Each embedded list is a document :type list_of_text: list

Returns:

Each embedded list contains tuples in the form (word id, embedded value)

Return type:

corpus (list)

root.src.model.tm.tm_train module

Contains functions related to training topic models

root.src.model.tm.tm_train.build_gensim_model(model_name: str, corpus: MmCorpus, id2word: Dictionary, num_topics: int, random_state=0)[source]

Build a model from gensim

Parameters:

  • model_name (string) – Name of model to build. lda or nmf or lsa.

  • corpus (gensim corpus) – Bag of words based corpus

  • id2word (gensim dictionary object) – gensim dict, contains word mappings

  • num_topics (int) – Number of topics

  • random_state (int) – Random seed

Returns:

trained gensim model

Return type:

(gensim model)

root.src.model.tm.tm_train.compute_coherence_score(model_name: str, corpus: MmCorpus, id2word: Dictionary, lemma_text: List[List[str]], num_topics: int, random_state=0, coherence_metric='c_v') → int[source]

Build a gensim model and evaluate coherence

Parameters:

  • model_name (string) – Name of model to used. lda or nmf or lsa.

  • corpus (gensim corpus object) – Bag of words based corpus

  • id2word (gensim dictionary object) – gensim dict, contains word mappings

  • lemma_text (list) – List containing lists of all the lemmatised words per sample

  • num_topics (int) – Number of topics

  • random_state (int) – Random seed

  • coherence_metric (string) – A gensim coherence metric

Returns:

coherence score

Return type:

(int)

root.src.model.tm.tm_train.evaluate_topic_models(model_name: List[str], corpuses: dict, id2word: Dictionary, lemma_text: List[List[str]], num_topics: List[int]) → DataFrame[source]

Run different gensim algorithms with different corpus inputs and number of topics.

Parameters: model_name (list): Collection of different algorithm names from gensim corpuses (dictionary): Key - ‘bow’ or ‘tfidf’. Value - gensim corpus object id2word (gensim dictionary object): gensim dict, contains word mappings lemma_text (list): List containing lists of all the lemmatised words per sample num_topics (list): Range of number of topics to try topic modelling with

Returns:

(pd.DataFrame) Dataframe with coherence score for each corpus + num_topic combination

root.src.model.tm.tm_train.train_and_persist_tm() → None[source]

Train the selected topic model
